intro: Gladiolus alanyensis, commonly known as the Alanyan gladiolus, is a rare species native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to deep red. The plant belongs to the Iridaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of a spike of brightly colored blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
